academic.title: Academic contributions
academic.summary: During my academic years I always seeked opportunities to participate in workshops, projects, school events and so on. This page summarizes all my presentations, publications and other academic activities. You can open all cards further to display images.

one.title: BirdCam project
one.summary: I presented my BirdCam project, from creating the first prototype to the final publication. My work had positive feedback and I was offere₫ to publish it in the Newsletter of The Hungarian IT Teachers' Association.
one.description: You can see more about my BirdCam project on the Projects page.

two.title: About our ‘maths for fun’ workshop
two.summary: As a core member of the workshop, I gave a presentation about the workshop’s mentality, the kind of questions we look at together during the sessions and I also mentioned some discrete maths questions that I really enjoyed thinking about during the past year.
two.description: Another riddle I mentioned in my presentation: A street vendor sells letters carved out of wood. They do not reveal how much each letter costs, but he does provide the following information: ONE costs $1, TWO costs $2, ELEVEN costs $11. How much does the word 'TWELVE' cost?

three.title: My favourite math exercises of this year’s workshop
three.summary: I represented our maths workshop, where I talked about some of my favourite problems, questions and exercises of the year.
three.description: Some of the topics I touched were the proof that Cantor's set's cardinality is Continuum, the importance of the precise use of terms when talking about maths, my hypothesis-tester application I wrote and demonstrated and the mathematics of the Rubik's cube.

four.title: How does a computer solve the Rubik’s cube?
four.summary: I held one of the math workshop sessions with a one hour long presentation about the algorithms of twisty puzzles, the algorithmic approach of the solution for computer programs, the principles used for solving a cube and so on.
four.description: Some parts of my presentation: What is a Rubik's cube, how does one solve a Rubik's cube, A* search algorithm, notations, lower- and upper bound, God's number, Thistlethwaithe's algorithm, Korf algorithm, solving the cube with computers.

five.title: 3 reasons to learn databases
five.summary: I gave a presentation about the importance of SQL and relational databases from a software developer’s point of view, I gave some practical examples where such knowledge is beneficial, and I presented the database structure of my BSc diploma work, along with its constraints and implementation.

birdcam.location: Newsletter of The Association of Hungarian IT Teachers
birdcam.summary: A detailed guide on how to build my BirdCam project from scratch, with the hardware and software configurations.
birdcam.description: You can read in more detail about my BirdCam project on the Projects page.

one.title: Adhered to my university’s ‘maths for fun’ workshop
one.summary: During my first few weeks at university I adhered to a mathematics student workshop, where I became one of the core members and I helped organising the workshop sessions for 3 years.
one.description: There were weekly workshop sessions where we talked about discrete maths, calculus and many math-related topics. It was the perfect place to think together, ask questions and become familiar with abstract ideas.

two.title: Became a Calculus teacher demonstrator
two.summary: During my second semester I had the honor of becoming a calculus demonstrator, where I worked together with my teacher on developing new materials and organising weekly workshops.
two.description: A demonstrator is like a teacher assistant. I helped with the development of calculus materials with LaTeX and RegEx, we organised weekly workshops and I also managed a school website about the workshop's activity.

whoami1.title: Who am I?
whoami1.description: I am a Hungarian computer science graduate (since 2024) who strives to become a better developer and I chose to create this creative outlet to share my thoughts and work with anyone interested (and to learn React whilst creating something useful).

whoami2.title: What is this site for?
whoami2.description: I love building stuff. I appreciate the process of creating something that solves a problem, and seeing it evolve through every step of the way.

studies1.title: Computer Science BSc
studies1.description: I had an active academic life during my studies: I was a calculus demonstrator, I was member of numerous student workshops, I regularly gave presentations on school events (more on the academics page). My diploma work was titled 'Creating a product-rating database server' which was well-received by the jury and got an Excellent grade.'

studies2.title: Computer Science MSc
studies2.description: I enjoyed my BSc studies so much that it was no question if I wanted to continue my academic years. I chose drone-technology because I think it is a fascinating topic, and I felt it would be a good challenge, especially with the maths-heavy image analysis aspect of this specialization.

work1.title: Qlex Cloud [qlex.cloud]
work1.description: I worked on an eQMS system for pharmaceutical professionals, following strict ISO standards and industry practices. Amongst others, I worked on CD/CI tasks, queries with Spring JPA, frontend development.

work2.title: ArchX [archx.eu]
work2.description: I worked on a project management software (SaaS) for architects. My work mostly revolved around building RESTful APIs, building filters for dashboarding purposes and frontend development.
